messageBody:
I think it appears that what I need to do is create a runner to collect
the classes and the methods. After that, it is a matter of executing
the tests defined in the test "prototype" I've created.

That looks closer to what I want, but now is there a way to have the
@DataPoints dynamically generated. For example, collecting all the
classes that extend a base class and then iterate over all the methods
that match a specific signature?

In short, I want to generate these datapoints using reflection. I know
how to identify the details of what I want to test, I'm just not sure
how to inject it into the JUnit framework.

So, let me try to understand what these annotations do in a separate
email (It will help me wrap my head around things a bit better).
